Dear Mr. Gehm,
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, a provisional license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and feel free to contact me with
any questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please feel free to contact Greg Corrigan, Area manager at 269-337-5289.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
Bureau of Children and Adult Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684

II. METHODOLOGY

06/02/03/2014 Clearances received

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Wellspring Lutheran Services is located at 1260 South Otsego Avenue in Gaylord
Michigan. The facility has 12 offices and a conference room that staff utilize. The
program also has an office in Alpena, Michigan that serves as a place for the Licensing
Worker to conduct home development in the northeast sector of the State. This
consultant visited the office in Gaylord on 05/19/14. The office has adequate space and
resources to provide for program operations. It is centrally located to serve the northern
tier of the Lower Peninsula.
B. Program Description
Wellspring Lutheran Services has been operating child placing programming out of the
Gaylord office since 1999. The program and office has functioned as a satellite site for
the licensed parent agency located at 6019 West Side Saginaw Road in Bay City,
Michigan. The parent agency license number is #CB090201254 and is licensed to
certify foster homes, place children in foster care and provide independent living
services. The Gaylord program site serves the geographical area consisting of the
northern tier counties of the Lower Peninsula. Fifteen counties total are being served.
Currently the program has 24 licensed foster homes and 44 children placed in foster
care. There are no youth in independent living at this time. The program is adequately
staffed and consists of a CEO, Division Director, Program Manager/Supervisor, four
Case Managers, a Licensing Supervisor, two Licensing Workers, a Recruitment/Intake
Worker, two Case Aides, and three Secretaries. The program is actively engaged in
foster home recruitment activities.
Due to the size of the program and for logistical reasons the agency is requesting to
obtain a separate license for the Gaylord site, but it will remain part of the parent
agency.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The program is in compliance with all rule and statutory regulations.
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the agency be granted a provisional license.
July 11, 2014
